meanings.definition: The act of compressing or being compressed.
meanings.sent1: During CPR, the chest compressions are crucial for helping the person breathe.
meanings.sent2: The compressions of the spring made the toy car move forward.
meanings.sent3: The compressions of the suitcase made it look like it was on a diet!
meanings.sent4: The compressions of time seemed to make the days fly by.
meanings.sent5: The compressions of the sponge absorbed all the water in an instant.

meanings.definition: A force that causes a material to become compacted.
meanings.sent1: The compressions from the weight of the books flattened the cardboard box.
meanings.sent2: The compressions of the soil by heavy machinery made it harder for plants to grow.
meanings.sent3: The compressions from the falling rocks turned the sand into a solid block.
meanings.sent4: The compressions of the crowd made it difficult to move through the concert hall.
meanings.sent5: The compressions of the hammer on the nail secured the pieces together.

meanings.definition: A reduction in size or volume.
meanings.sent1: The compressions of the plastic bottle made it easier to recycle.
meanings.sent2: The compressions of the gas in the container caused it to shrink.
meanings.sent3: The compressions of the dough while baking turned it into a small cookie.
meanings.sent4: The compressions of the accordion folded it neatly for storage.
meanings.sent5: The compressions of the spring decreased the length of the metal coil.
